You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee b

You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start

You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lun

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including: a loaf of bread, a bag of chips, and some chocolate ice cream. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediate

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including: a loaf of bread, a bag of chips, and some chocolate ice cream. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including: a loaf of bread, a bag of chips, and some chocolate ice cream. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including: a loaf of bread, a bag of chips, and some chocolate ice cream. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including: a loaf of bread, a bag of chips, and some chocolate ice cream. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

"That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sand

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including: a loaf of bread, a bag of chips, and some chocolate ice cream. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

"That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, includinga loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without you

You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again

You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan.

You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your moth

Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice throu

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic par

You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munc

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munch

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats.

So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Al

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Alfred a sandwich,

So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Alfred a sandwich, but he says that bees only eat pollen from flowers, not from sandwiches. You ask why Al

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Alfred a sandwich, but he says that bees only eat pollen from flowers, not from sandwiches. You ask why Alfred refused to let you put peanut butter in the borwn

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. You offer Alfred a sandwich, but he says that bees only eat pollen from flowers, not from sandwiches. You ask why Alfred refused to let you put peanut butter in the brownie bat

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Alfred a sandwich, but he says that bees only eat pollen from flowers, not from sandwiches. You ask why Alfred refused to let you put peanut butter in the brownie batter. Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Alfred a sandwich, but he says that bees only eat pollen from flowers, not from sandwiches. You ask why Alfred refused to let you put peanut butter in the brownie batter. Alfred says that he can sense you have a severe allergy to peanut butter. He doesn't want you to end up in the hospital because of it. You're surprised si

So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Alfred a sandwich, but he says that bees only eat pollen from flowers, not from sandwiches. You ask why Alfred refused to let you put peanut butter in the brownie batter. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Alfred a sandwich, but he says that bees only eat pollen from flowers, not from sandwiches. You ask why Alfred refused to let you put peanut butter in the brownie batter. Alfred says that he can sense you have a severe allergy to peanut butter. He doesn't want you to end up in the hospital because of it. You're surprised since you've never had a peanut allergy be

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?" The bee introduces himself to you as Alfred. You're surprised to hear a bee talking. He tells you that he's the bee that your mother ordered to protect you at all costs. You're confused because your mother never mentioned anything about bees. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. Moreover, why would she order a bee to protect you? You've spent your entire life actively avoiding bees. Your mother has forbidden you to even go near them. Alfred says that your mother had given him orders to protect you all day. He tells you that jobs like these are his specialty. You ask what his job title is and he says he's a "Guard Bee." Well, how about that! You've never even heard of a guard bee before, and now here you are talking to one!

You ask Alfred why your mother thought you needed his help. He says that your mother worries about you a lot. She ordered Alfred to protect you and make sure you don't do anything stupid. You laugh and ask if he's really going to be able to protect you. "Try me," he says, and flies off your shoulder. You say that you want to go for a bike ride. Alfred says he'll follow you. You ask if he thinks you should pack a picnic lunch too. Alfred says "Of course!" So you go to the pantry in your kitchen and you start assembling treats for lunch, including a loaf of bread and a bag of chips. You end up preparing chicken salad sandwiches, tuna salad sandwiches, ham salad sandwiches, and egg salad sandwiches. And you also end up preparing some cookies, some brownies, and some strawberry shortcake. You start to add peanut butter to the brownie batter but Alfred stops you immediately. "That's not good for you," he tells you. You ask why. He says he'll explain it to you later, but for now you should just leave it out of the batter. You comply, but you're a little suspicious.

Later you go on your picnic, with your bike basket loaded up with all your treats and sandwiches. You're about to take off without your helmet but Alfred stops you again. He tells you that there's something important about helmets. You have to wear one. You groan. You can practically hear your mother's voice through Alfred's. You put on your helmet and kick off with Alfred on your shoulder. Later, you get to the picnic park and start munching your treats. You offer Alfred a sandwich, but he says that bees only eat pollen from flowers, not from sandwiches. You ask why Alfred refused to let you put peanut butter in the brownie batter. Alfred says that he can sense you have a severe allergy to peanut butter. He doesn't want you to end up in the hospital because of it. You're surprised since you've never had a peanut allergy before. "It's new," Alfred tells you. You start to ask Alfred how he knows all this about you, but you're interrupted by a bee.
